news_header: Students from Turku, Tampere University, and Åbo Akademi are competing in an international synthetic biology competition in Paris, focusing on food innovation for space travel.
news_text: A group of students from Turku and Tampere University and Åbo Akademi has spent the summer working on a project to produce vitamins A and C using genetically modified E. coli for the ABOA2024 team competing in the world's largest international synthetic biology competition in Paris. Their approach aims to address food production challenges in long-duration space flights, as traditional plant-based solutions are space-consuming and slow-growing. The team emphasizes the importance of producing nutritious food efficiently in space, and their project has been a year in the making. The competition will evaluate not only their innovation but also their media outreach and public engagement efforts.
